chav1961.purelib.basic

Class TemporaryStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.basic.TemporaryStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class TemporaryStore
extends Object
implements Closeable

    This class is a store manager for temporary files. It designs to use in the predefined scenario for temporary file :

    • get TemporaryStore.InputOutputPair class instance
    • get OutputStream from the instance and fill output content to temporary file
    • get InputStream from the instance and load input content from temporary file
    • close instance

    This class is maximized to speed on little files (keeps content in RAM) and maximized memory on large files (uses ZLib compression). Switching from RAM usage and file system usage makes automatically during filling process. To prevent uncontrolled expansion of the RAM used, a maximal limit of the RAM buffer is used.

    This class implements Closeable interface and can be user in the try-with-resource statements.

    This class can be used in the multi-threaded environment.

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    LoggerFacade, FileSystemInterface, JUnit tests

      • TemporaryStore

        public TemporaryStore(int maxBufferSize)
               throws IllegalArgumentException,
                      IOException

        Constructor of the class. Create class instance with null logger and file-based filesystem on "java.io.tmpdir" location

        Parameters:
        maxBufferSize - max RAM buffer size to use
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when buffer size less than default buffer size and greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE / 16
        IOException - on any I/O errors

    • Method Detail

      • close

      • allocate

        public TemporaryStore.InputOutputPair allocate()
                                        throws IOException

        Allocate TemporaryStore.InputOutputPair class to support predefined scenario. Allocated instance must be used in the try-with-resource statement or must be explicitly closed by call TemporaryStore.InputOutputPair.close() method. This call frees instance and return it to the instance's pool

        TemporaryStore.InputOutputPair instance is not reusable. To create another temporary file you need to call allocate() again.

        Returns:
        TemporaryStore.InputOutputPair instance to use
        Throws:
        IOException - on any I/O errors
